quizzes.title: History Quiz: State and Town
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, flifo, towns. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Your flight has been delayed due to bad weather.  The  airline representative at the gate gives prompt updates concerning the time your flight may depart.  Behind the scenes, the technical term for the estimated time of departure is this one.
Which of these is the name of a small California town?
The Term FLIFO, in the airline industry refers to this.

options.text: Flight Factors (contingents such as weather and other potential delay factors)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flight Information

questions.question: If you end up spending the night in the town of Santa Clause, what state are you in?
A spinner in the airline industry refers to this.

options.text: A last-minute passenger, unable to locate their seat once aboard the aircraft
A wet runway, which requires additional braking room
A late arriving aircraft, which is reassigned  a gate position

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A last-minute passenger, unable to locate their seat once aboard the aircraft

questions.question: In this state there are two towns, named Green Level.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Carolina

questions.question: In what state is the town of Diagonal located?
In modern aircraft, the flight crew will consist of 3 persons on the flight deck.
In which state will you find the town of Cementville?
The town of French Lick is located in the state of Ohio.
In the airline industry, the term PAX, most commonly refers to which of the following?

options.text: A popular cable channel available on certain flights
The baggage compartment on an aircraft

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A passenger

questions.question: Department of Transportation (DOT) on-time departure statistics are measured based on the time the aircraft actually leaves the ground.

The reading lamp in the Passenger Control Unit (PCU) above your seat has burned out. After the flight crew consults with local maintenance,  they fill out a form, indicating that it is safe to let this aircraft fly under the aforementioned condition.  What is the aircraft industrys technical term for this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MEL PLACARD

questions.question: In the airline industry, a child travelling without an adult, is referred to as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UM or UNAM

questions.question: In what state is the town of Monkeys Eyebrow located?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Airline and Airline Industry
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, baggage, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is an airline hub?

options.text: An interfaced, virtual aircraft tracking system, linked to the FAAs arrival /departure scopes, which  monitors a given airport.
The central processing control data unit of a particular airlines computers.
The cargo cities located around the perimeters of most major airports.
A centrally located airport, which contains an airlines facilities, as well as systems operations for the entire system. The majority of airlines flights utilize the hub.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A centrally located airport, which contains an airlines facilities, as well as systems operations for the entire system. The majority of airlines flights utilize the hub.

questions.question: The bus line which primarily serves the San Francisco Peninsula is known as this.

options.text: Stanford Area Transit or SAT for short!

questions.question: If youre on the Blue Line, heading to Clinton/ Congress Station, which Tourist Attraction/ Area of Interest is nearby?
If youre on the Blue Line, heading to Clinton/ Congress Station, what city are you in?
PATH stands for this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Port Authority Trans Hudson

questions.question: BART stands for this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bay Area Rapid Transit

questions.question: In the airline industry, what are in trails restrictions?

options.text: Ground tracks which must be followed using VFR (Visual Flight Rules) on approach into a major airport.
Amount of spacing, or separation utilized for arriving, departing, and particularly, en-route aircraft.
A system of aircraft separation which is measured horizontally and vertically by air traffic control.
Radar tracks (AKA Glides or Trails), which pilots will often utilize to establish their glide-slope on approach to a given runway.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amount of spacing, or separation utilized for arriving, departing, and particularly, en-route aircraft.

questions.question: SEPTA stands for this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southeastern Pennsylvania Transit Authority

questions.question: Dry ice may be carried aboard an aircraft in the baggage compartment in small amounts. However, the Captain of the flight must receive a DI-595 (Dry Ice) notification prior to departure.
The Blue Line has its Terminus at this major Airport, one of the busiest in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago - OHare International

questions.question: Can firearms be carried on passengers aboard an aircraft?
PIREPS refers to what in the airline industry?

options.text: Representatives of an airline catering / confectionery group. Hence, Pie reports, or how many pies, pastries, etc. will be catered on any given flight.
A trade  lobbying group, representing airline pilots.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pilot reports.

questions.question: In the US airline industry, TSA stands for this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Transportation Security Administration

questions.question: The term flow control, in the airline industry, refers to which of the following?

options.text: Testing of all hydro systems on-board the aircraft prior to departure
The order in which aircraft are signed off gates for departures.
The time it takes the fueler to put on a full complement of fuel for the particular flight segment.
Taxiing away from the gate, and holding in a possibly remote area of the airport, due to flow restrictions at the arrival airport.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taxiing away from the gate, and holding in a possibly remote area of the airport, due to flow restrictions at the arrival airport.

questions.question: MARTA stands for this.

options.text: Massachusetts and Roxboro Rapid Transit Authority
Middlesboro and Annapolis Rapid Transit Authority

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Aircraft and Area
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, f-15, trenton. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1954 the French were defeated at this very famous battle partly because their area of defense received 50% more rain than any other area of Vietnam, which badly effected their equipment.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dien Bien Phu

questions.question: December 26, 1776 saw the Battle of Trenton in what was then the American colonies. Which statement explains why Washington was victorious?

options.text: The English and Hessian troops did not think the Americans could move during freezing cold weather.
The English and Hessian troops thought that the Americans would not attack during Christmas.
The Hessian and British troops were so ill from the cold that they could not defend themselves.
A terrible hurricane kept the British and Hessian troops from recon patrols.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The English and Hessian troops did not think the Americans could move during freezing cold weather.

questions.question: The F-15 was produced to compete with Soviet Migs.

In the early 18th century Charles XII of Sweden was undefeated until this happened. In 1812 Napoleons attempt to conquer Europe failed because of the same. Hitlers Operation Barbarossa was stopped by the same obstacle.

options.text: The lack of adequate water supplies in Northern Europe
The overabundance of muddy terrain in Northern Europe
The lack of grain in Eastern Europe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The frigid Russian winter

questions.question: What company manufactures the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter?
This aircraft was originally built as a tank buster.
The 88 Corbett is a Bus line serving which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco

questions.question: In World War I, the Germans used large amounts of poison gas against their enemies. In 1915 a large poison gas attack by Germany against the Russians failed. Why?

options.text: The German howitzers could not move in marshland.
The poison gas was dispersed by the very moist Russian summer.
The smog in Russia meant that the artillery shells were fired without knowing where to aim.
Because of the Russian winter the shells froze.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of the Russian winter the shells froze.

questions.question: MUNI serves San Francisco.
How did weather affect D-Day (the first day of the Invasion of Normandy in World War 2)?

options.text: The invasion was set for June 5 but the only break in the rainy weather came on June 6.
An unexpected cyclone hit central France stopping reinforcements from repelling the invasion.
The terrible weather stopped the German air force from flying that week.
Terrible rain storms hit the Normandy beaches slowing German tanks from helping the troops.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The invasion was set for June 5 but the only break in the rainy weather came on June 6.

questions.question: Which of these fighters was manufactured by North American Aviation in World War 2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P-51 Mustang

questions.question: This aircraft took the place of the Grumman Wildcat in World War II.
This aircraft was one of the first jet fighters used by the United States military.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: F-86 Sabre

questions.question: Both the invasion of the Roman Empire by Hannibal (217 BCE) and Ghenghis Khans invasion of China in the 13th century were made possible by this weather phenomenon.

options.text: Typhoons stopping naval forces from defending the invaded countries
Hurricanes deterred defending troops from meeting the enemy before they could get a foothold
The freezing of marshlands and rivers allowing mounted troops to invade
Unusually high temperatures causing grave illnesses on the defending troops

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The freezing of marshlands and rivers allowing mounted troops to invade

questions.question: The Chinese army was able to invade South Korea in 1951 because what river froze?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yalu

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Netherlands and South Carolina
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, exporter, carolina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Until 1890, the Dutch King was Head of State of this country.
Which religion has the most followers in the Netherlands?
Since it gained its independence from the Spanish Empire, the Netherlands has always been a monarchy.
In 1980, U.S. President Jimmy Carter tried to free American hostages via a helicopter attack. Where were these hostages held?
South Carolina and North Carolina were one colony under the British until 1712.
What was the name of the city that served as South Carolinas capital until 1790?
The Netherlands was the largest exporter of agricultural products in the world for 2006.
In which of the following countries is Dutch not an official language?
The Netherlands has the biggest sea port of Europe.
All military equipment is effected by weather. During the Vietnam War, the Americans expected their equipment to last an average of 8 years. On average, how long did the equipment last in reality?
Once there was a settlement called New Amsterdam (named after Amsterdam) that was sold to the British. Under what name is New Amsterdam now known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: For which flower is the Netherlands particularly famous?
What is the State Tree of South Carolina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cabbage palmetto

questions.question: South Carolina was the ___ state to join the Union after the end of the Revolutionary War.
What is the name of the capital and largest city of South Carolina?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, gullah, festival. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the term Gullah refer to?

options.text: A dialect spoken in the barrier islands of South Carolina and Georgia
A type of green leafy vegetable, similar to collard greens, eaten frequently in the South
A type of basket woven in the South Carolina lowcountry
A kind of thick soup, made from shrimp and rice and flavored with a hot pepper sauce

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A dialect spoken in the barrier islands of South Carolina and Georgia

questions.question: In which language Próspero año nuevo is used to wish Happy New Year?
South Carolina was the last of the southern states to secede from the Union in 1861.
The Chitlin Strut Festival is held every year in Salley, South Carolina and the attendees take part in a feast of chitlins and barbecue. What are chitlins?

options.text: The large intestine of a pig
A colorful mixture of chicken organs, such as hearts and livers, deep fried in batter, sliced and mixed with a peach mango salsa
A mixture of black-eyed peas and rice

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The large intestine of a pig

questions.question: In the city of Walnut it is illegal for any man or boy to dress as a woman. There is also a permit required for children to wear Halloween masks. In what U.S. state is Walnut located?

On 12 April 1861, the first shots of the civil war were fired on the U.S. Army garrison in Beaufort South Carolina, thus beginning the Civil War. (Known to many in South Carolina as the war of Northern Aggression.)
The 1991 Ryder Cup matches, known as the War by the Shore, won by the US (or, more correctly lost by the Europeans) were played where in South Carolina?

options.text: The Dunes Golf and Beach Club, Dunes Course, in Myrtle Beach
Harbour Town Golf Links at Hilton Head

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kiawah Islands Ocean Course

questions.question: Due to a police officer being sprayed by silly string, the sale of silly string was banned in the city of Southington. In what U.S. state is Southington located?
Which southwestern U.S. state actually has a law on the books making it illegal to sell or manufacture imitation cocaine?
The city of Gainsville has a law requiring chicken to be eaten only with the hands. What U.S. state is Gainsville located in?
In what U.S. state is it illegal to dye baby chicks or ducklings blue and offer them for sale?
In what northwest U.S. state is it illegal for a motorist with criminal intentions to enter a city without first stopping to call the chief of police for the city?
In what U.S. state is it illegal to catch fish using the bare hands?
What Smoky Mountain U.S. state has made it illegal to bring a skunk into the state?
In what midwestern U.S. state is it legal to protest naked in front of city hall?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: New Year and Thanksgiving
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, jaron, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many pounds of pumpkins were produced for Thanksgiving 2005?
How many lbs. of sweet potatoes were produced in the U.S. for Thanksgiving 2005?
How would you say Happy New Year during a party in Rio de Janeiro?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feliz Ano Novo

questions.question: In which language the New Year greetings are sound like Kalí hroniá?
How many million lbs. of cranberries were produced for Thanksgiving 2005?
Where in the Americas could you wish Happy New Year by saying Bonne année?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quebec, Canada

questions.question: Feliĉan novan jaron is the New Year greeting in Esperanto. Where is this language natively spoken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nowhere, its an artificial language

questions.question: How many bushels of wheat were produced for Thanksgiving 2005?
“AaeEmonae” is used in which Native American language to wish a Happy New Year?
In which part of Africa could you most likely hear Gelukkige nuwe jaar when a New Year celebrations start?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: The New Year greeting, Bliadhna mhath ùr, could be used in which part of the UK?
Which of these greetings in different languages is more proper for Christmas than for New Year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wesołych  Świąt

questions.question: Which greeting means Happy New Year in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shanah Tovah

questions.question: How many million turkeys were raised in the U.S. for the 2005 Thanksgiving holiday?
What was the value of turkeys imported from Canada for Thanksgiving 2005?
